active_learning.discussion_prompt: In a group discussion, debate the ethical and legal implications of incomplete third-party data sharing disclosures in mobile apps (e.g., hidden analytics SDKs). Reference FDIC 2023 guidance and app store policies: How does non-disclosure impact user trust and regulatory compliance? Propose two improvements.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in university-level pedagogy (Bloom's Taxonomy, active learning, scaffolding). Topic: Third-Party Data Sharing Disclosure (Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > 008_Application Security > Mobile 008_Application Security > 007_Privacy Controls > Privacy Policy and Transparency > Level 6). Use this content: Core Concepts: Third-party relationship (external data processors), data sharing, disclosure (transparency on practices/risks), risk management. Standards: FDIC/Federal Reserve/OCC June 2023 Guidance (third-party lifecycle risk mgmt: plan, due diligence, contract, oversight, contingency; tailored to complexity); NIST SP 800-53 Rev 3/5 (SA family: SA-4 external services acquisition/security; SA-9 external config mgmt; emphasizes disclosure in acquired systems). Mobile: Google Play Data Safety, App Store Privacy Labels for SDKs. Sources: FDIC.gov interagency guidance, NIST.gov SP 800-53, developer.apple.com/app-store/review/guidelines/#data-collection-and-storage, play.google.com/about/data-safety. Learning Objectives: [Insert full list from above]. Scaffolding: [Insert full 4 layers]. Active Learning: [Insert summaries for context/inspiration]. Generate 50 flashcards per the exact schema: Front (Question/MC), Back (Answer + Explanation + Distractors rationale if MC + Metadata). Ensure measurable verbs, prior links (privacy basics), completeness (full NIST/FDIC desc, examples/templates), interconnections (concept map style). Output as JSON array of objects: [{'front': '...', 'back': {'answer': '...', 'explanation': '...', 'metadata': {...}}}]. Vary difficulty, no repetition, high educational value.
